attributes.action: Stop the Misuse of Sponsorship Visas by Off-License Shop Owners
attributes.additional_details:
Restrict the ability of small businesses such as off-license shops to sponsor overseas workers unless it can be proven that no suitable UK resident is available.

Investigate cases of sponsorship abuse and hold accountable those who exploit the visa system.

Create stronger incentives for businesses to recruit from the UK’s existing workforce.

It is vital that the immigration system is used fairly and responsibly, and that UK residents are given first opportunity for employment.
attributes.background: The Government should stop off-license shops misusing visa sponsorships to hire unqualified overseas workers. Instead, they must prioritise hiring UK residents, reducing unemployment, benefit reliance, and protecting the integrity of the immigration system.

rejection.details:
The following petitions cover this issue:

Mandate Local Hiring and Restrict Offshore Hiring of workers
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/726852

Require companies to employ minimum 70% UK nationals before sponsoring others 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/731797
